Sentencas: The performance of a Ni-SDC anode-supported cell operating with a dry CH4 feed stream and the effectiveness of exposing the anode to H-2 as a method of removing carbon deposits are evaluated.
Titulo: Direct-methane solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) with Ni-SDC anode-supported cell

Sentencas: This has involved the continuous monitoring of the outlet gas composition during CH4 operation and H-2 exposure.
Titulo: Direct-methane solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) with Ni-SDC anode-supported cell

Sentencas: A degradation rate in the cell voltage (similar to 1.33 mV h(-1)) is observed during 100 h operation with dry CH4.
Titulo: Direct-methane solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) with Ni-SDC anode-supported cell

Sentencas: Carbon is detected in the Ni-SDC anode after the stability test but only in the portion of the anode closest to the fuel channel.
Titulo: Direct-methane solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) with Ni-SDC anode-supported cell

Sentencas: No carbon is detected at the electrolyte-anode interface, which is the likely reason that the cell performance remains relatively stable.
Titulo: Direct-methane solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) with Ni-SDC anode-supported cell

Sentencas: The information obtained from SEM and gas outlet composition analyses can be explained by a process whereby most of the CH4 that reacts decomposes into H-2 and C in the Ni-SDC anode near the fuel channel.
Titulo: Direct-methane solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) with Ni-SDC anode-supported cell

Sentencas: H-2 then makes its way to the anode-electrolyte interface where it is electrochemically oxidized to H2O which can also react with any C that may have formed, leaving behind C primarily at the fuel channel.
Titulo: Direct-methane solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) with Ni-SDC anode-supported cell

Sentencas: When an aged cell is exposed to H-2, carbon-containing gases (CO, CH4 and CO2) are released, indicating that some carbon has been removed from the anode.
Titulo: Direct-methane solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) with Ni-SDC anode-supported cell

Sentencas: Examination of the anode after the test shows that some carbon still remains after this treatment.
Titulo: Direct-methane solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) with Ni-SDC anode-supported cell
